issuetype.name: Bug

projectCategory.description: Titanium and related SDKs used in application development
projectCategory.name: Client

resolution.description: Is not a bug in our product
resolution.name: Not Our Bug

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description:
"*Microsoft Azure Notification Hub*" module not working on iOS 10. Its showing *"could not find module : com.azure.......  for architecture:arm64"*. Although its working perfectly on below iOS 10 devices.

*Testing Environment:*
Operating System
  Name                        = Mac OS X
  Version                     = 10.11.3
  Architecture                = 64bit
  # CPUs                      = 4
  Memory                      = 4294967296
Node.js
  Node.js Version             = 4.6.0
  npm Version                 = 2.15.9
Titanium CLI
  CLI Version                 = 5.0.9
Titanium SDK
  SDK Version                 = 5.5.1.GA
  SDK Path                    = /Users/GSLMAC3/Library/Application Support/Titanium/mobilesdk/osx/3.2.1.GA/mobilesdk/osx/5.5.1.GA
  Target Platform             = iphone
Devices: iOS 10.0.2 iPhone 5s, iPod 5G (9.3.5)

*Step to reproduce:*
1) Just download the module from Market Place
2) Add to the appcelerator project and require the module.
3) Run to the device

Output added to the screen shoot. Thanks
fields.summary: "Microsoft Azure Notification Hub" module is not working on iOS 10

comments.body: Please correct me if I'm wrong, but the module is not one of our curated modules, so the vendor of the module should take take of problems occurring with it.

[~hansknoechel], Thanks. But the module support section shows Appcelerator marketplace support email . You can see it [here|https://marketplace.appcelerator.com/apps/11522?restoreSearch=true#!support]. BTW I am referring the customer to get help from Microsoft Azure support.
